abstract.text: The KLOE Collaboration completed the full data taking on March 2006, acquiring 2.5 f b −1 at the peak of the φ and other 240 pb −1 off-peak.
A new Collaboration is working on a new project, called KLOE-2, to refine and extend the KLOE physics program.

We present here some preliminary and published results from the KLOE Collaboration on the pseudoscalar η meson and the study of γγ processes, that are among the main points of the KLOE-2 physics program.

body_text.text: Introduction
The KLOE experiment has collected 2.5 f b −1 at the peak of the φ resonance at the e + e − collider DAΦNE in Frascati.

KLOE has performed several precision measurements, here we present the preliminary analysis of the η → π + π − γ decay channel to study box anomaly and the recently published branching ratio measurement of η → e + e − e + e − decay channel, never observed before.

Pseudoscalar production at the φ-factory associated to internal conversion of the photon into a lepton pair allows the measurement of the form factor F(q 2 1 = M(φ) 2 , q 2 2 > 0) of pseudoscalar mesons in the kinematical region of interest for the VMD model: a preliminary study of φ → ηe + e − is based on 739 pb −1 , using the η → π + π − π 0 final state.
From a sample of 240 pb −1 taken off the φ resonance, a preliminary analysis of the e + e − → e + e − η process, without e ± tagging in the final state has been performed.
The same data set has been used to search for the f 0 (600) produced in γγ interactions via the reaction e + e − → e + e − π 0 π 0 .
The KLOE detector is being upgraded with small angle tagging devices, to detect both high and low energy e ± in e + e − → e + e − X events.
The inner tracker and small angle calorimeters are scheduled to be installed in a subsequent step, providing wider acceptance for both charged particles and photons.
This is the new KLOE-2 project [1]: the detector is successfully rolled in the new DAΦNE interaction region, with a new beam crossing scheme allowing for a reduced beam size and increased luminosity.
The main goal of KLOE-2 is to collect an integrated luminosity of about 20 f b −1 in 2-3 years in order to refine and extend the KLOE physics programme.
The Pseudoscalar η meson
The decays η, η ′ → π + π − γ are supposed to get contribution from the anomaly accounted by the Wess Zumino Witten term into the Chiral Perturbation Theory Lagrangian [2].
Those anomalous processes, known as box anomalies, proceed via a vector meson resonant contribution (VDM) and maybe via a direct term.
The presence of this direct term affects the partial width value in the case of the η → π + π − γ and the dipion invariant mass distribution, in the case of
A comparison of the experimental M π + π − spectra and partial width for η, η ′ meson with theoretical predictions is mandatory to clarify the role of non-resonant contribution to the processes.
The η → π + π − γ decay has been measured in 1970 by Gormley et al. (7250 events) [3] and in the 1973 by Layter et al. (18150 events) [4].
Theoretical papers trying to combine the two measurements found discrepancies in data treatment and problems in obtaining consistent results [2].
In 2007 CLEO Coll.
has published the measurement Γ η→π + π − γ /Γ η→π + π − π 0 = 0.175 ± 0.007 ± 0.006, based on 859 η → π + π − γ events [5], which is more then 3σ below the old measurements.

The knowledge of the η meson coupling to virtual photons is important for calculation of anomalous magnetic moment of the muon, because the pseudoscalar exchange is the major contribution to the hadron light-by-light scattering [1].

In the η → e + e − e + e − process we have conversion decays, which offer the possibility to precisely measure the virtual photon 4-momentum, via the e + and e − 4-momenta and we are directly sensitive to the η meson transition form factor because there are no hadrons among the decay products.
The first theoretical evaluation dates from 1967 [7] and predicts a branching ratio BR(η → e + e − e + e − ) = 2.59 × 10 −5 .
Double lepton-antilepton η decays have been searched by CMD-2 and WASA, obtaining upper limits at level of the theoretical expectation.

KLOE has published the first observation of the η → e + e − e + e − decay, analysing 1.7 f b −1 and identifing 362 ± 29 events which results in a branching ratio of (2.4 ± 0.2 stat+bkg ± 0.1 syst ) × 10 −5 , in agreement with theoretical predictions [8].

Vector-meson-dominance assumption provides good description of photon coupling to hadrons, and, implementing systematic corrections to standard VMD, it correctly describes the ω → π 0 µ + µ − experimental results too.
In this framework deviation from standard VMD for the φ → ηe + e − decay spectrum is predicted.
The only existing data available come from SND experiment, which has measured the M ee invariant mass distribution with 213 events [9].
KLOE has selected 7000 φ → ηe + e − with η → π + π − π 0 using a sample of 739 pb −1 .
Preliminary fit to the M ee using decay parametrization from [10] and F(q 2 ) as from [11], indicates the possibility to reach a 5% error on form factor slope.
Gamma-gamma Physics

The coupling of photons to scalar and pseudoscalar mesons brings information on meson's quark structure and can be measured directly in e + e − colliders via the reaction e + e − → e + e − γ * γ * → e + e − X. Using the Weizsäcker-Williams approximation [12] to understand main qualitative features of the process, when no cuts are applied to the final state leptons, it is possible to evaluate the event yields: N eeX = L ee dF dW γγ σ γγ→X (W γγ )dW γγ the L ee is the integrated luminosity, W γγ is the mass of the γ * γ * and dF/dW γγ the two photons flux function, defined as follows:
Single π 0 or η production is accessible and this allows to improve determination of two photon decay width of these meson.

In particular KLOE is looking for e + e − → e + e − η with η → π + π − π 0 final state: in a preliminary analysis of 240 pb −1 off-peak data about 600 events from η meson, produced in γγ interactions have been disentangled, versus other processes, with a statistical accuracy on Γ γγ comparable with existing measurements.
The same off-peak data have been analysed to search for e + e − → e + e − η with η → π 0 π 0 π 0 final state.
The question concerning σ/ f 0 (600) meson has been debated for a long time.
An indirect evidence comes from φ → π 0 π 0 γ KLOE analysis [13].
The e + e − → e + e − π 0 π 0 process is a clean electromagnetic probe to investigate the question, because it is expected to be plainly affected by σ contribution.
Our preliminary analysis on the off-peak data, shows a clear enhancement over estimated backgrounds at low M 4γ ; see Fig.1.

Due to large background from e + e − → γγ(γ), information from e ± taggers already installed at KLOE-2, will be crucial in the analysis of new data to look for the production of σ.
The KLOE experiment with 2.5 f b −1 integrated luminosity at the peak of the φ resonance at the e + e − collider DAΦNE, has published several interesting results.
In the next future a new data-taking campaign will be realized by KLOE-2 at the upgraded DAΦNE, with the aim to collect about 20 f b −1 in order to refine and extend the KLOE physics program.
